reasoning: Ultra-rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder (Mabry syndrome) with prevalence <1 in 1,000,000. Characterized by moderate-to-severe intellectual disability, dysmorphic features, hypotonia, seizures, and persistent hyperphosphatasia. Multiple genes implicated (PIGL, PGAP2, PGAP3, and others). Extremely limited epidemiological data; estimated ~20 individuals with PGAP2 variants documented globally.
source: Orphanet database, multiple PMC case reports and reviews (Diagnostic Pathology 2019, PMC 2023)
